title: After a glacial dam outburst destroyed homes in Alaska, a look at the risks of melting ice masses
description: Residents in Alaska’s capital city have lived with periodic glacial dam outbursts for more than a decade

title: 3 fishermen plucked from Atlantic waters off Nantucket by Coast Guard helicopter crew
description: Three fishermen who were not wearing life jackets were plucked alive from ocean waters by the Coast Guard five miles east of the Nantucket Saturday afternoon

title: Mexico shutters 23 pharmacies at Caribbean coast resorts after US warned of dangerous pill sales
description: Mexico has closed 23 pharmacies at Caribbean coast resorts, six months after a research report warned that drug stores in Mexico were offering foreigners pills they passed off as Oxycodone, Percocet, and Adderall

title: Idaho man charged with shooting rifle at two hydroelectric power stations
description: An Idaho man has been charged with two counts of destruction of an energy facility after federal prosecutors said he shot a rifle at two hydroelectric power stations and caused damage to both

title: Mayor finds 70 pounds of cocaine while on fishing trip in the Florida Keys
description: Tampa Mayor Jane Castor helped reel in 70 pounds of cocaine while fishing last month in the Florida Keys, her office confirmed on Tuesday.

title: NYC mayor says busing migrants is 'dehumanizing'
description: According to the mayor’s office, 57,200 asylum seekers are currently in the city’s care and nearly 100,000 migrants have arrived since last spring.

title: Vice President Kamala Harris touts 'raise' for some union workers under new rule
description: Vice President Kamala Harris traveled to Philadelphia Tuesday to highlight the administration's new rule to raise wage standards for some construction workers.

title: Ohioans vote in high-stakes special election that could affect abortion rights
description: If adopted, Ohio's State Issue 1 would require a 60% vote threshold to amend the state's constitution -- imposing a new hurdle for an abortion rights amendment.

title: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried still faces campaign finance charge, prosecutors say
description: Prosecutors had dropped the charge against Bankman-Fried last month on a technicality.

title: There's a new dominant COVID variant in the US. Here's what to know about EG.5
description: CDC data shows a new COVID variant, EG.5, an offshoot of omicron, is becoming the dominant variant in the U.S. Here's what you need to know.

title: 3 charged with assault in Alabama riverfront melee; no bias charges
description: Police in Montgomery, Alabama, announced assault charges against three men after a brawl at Riverfront Park that began when a Black dock employee was allegedly attacked.

title: WATCH:  Toddler jams to Bob Marley after being fitted with hearing aids
description: Sixteen-month-old Sully couldn't help but dance to "Three Little Birds" by Bob Marley and the Wailers.

title: Will Threads kill X? Experts weigh in.
description: The task of overtaking X poses a formidable challenge but Threads holds advantages, they said.

title: WATCH:  Vet shows how he dislodges wood chip stuck in golden retriever's mouth
description: Dr. Thomas Hamilton recently posted a TikTok video showing him dislodging a wood chip from a sedated golden retriever's mouth. He also shared some tips on how to prevent this.

title: Judge rules Southwest failed to follow order in flight attendant free-speech case
description: A federal judge is heaping sanctions on Southwest Airlines for, he says, failing to follow his orders in a case involving a fired flight attendant's free-speech rights

title: Georgia fires football staffer who survived fatal crash after lawsuit
description: Georgia has fired the football recruiting staffer who survived a January crash that killed player Devin Willock and another recruiting staffer, less than a month after she filed a lawsuit against the university’s athletic association

title: Pence says he's met donor requirement to make first GOP debate, urges Trump to attend
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence has met the requirements for the first Republican debate on Aug. 23, his campaign said in a release on Tuesday morning

title: Thousands of L.A. city workers walk off job for 24 hours alleging unfair practices
description: Thousands of Los Angeles city employees, including sanitation workers, engineers and traffic officers, walked off the job for a 24-hour strike alleging unfair labor practices

title: DeSantis replaces 2024 campaign manager in high-level staffing shuffle: Sources
description: Ron DeSantis has replaced his presidential campaign manager, Generra Peck, with his gubernatorial office's chief of staff, James Uthmeier, several sources have confirmed

title: France ends Morocco's run and advances to the quarterfinals of the Women's World Cup
description: France has advanced to the quarterfinals of the Women’s World Cup by beating Morocco 4-0

title: UK police arrest suspect in stabbing near the British Museum in London
description: Police in London say they have arrested a man suspected of stabbing another man near the British Museum

title: Florida school board reverses decision on access to kids' book on male penguin couple
description: Months after access to a popular children’s book about a male penguin couple hatching a chick was restricted at school libraries because of Florida’s so-called Don’t Say Gay law, a central Florida school district says it has reversed that decision

title: Half a million without power in US after severe storms slam East Coast, killing 2
description: There were more than 600 damaging storm reports nationwide on Monday, mostly from New York state to Georgia.

title: Mega Millions jackpot estimated at record $1.55 billion for Tuesday's drawing
description: The cash payout option is estimated at $757.2 Million, the lottery said, adding that "at this level, jackpots are hard to predict with complete accuracy."

title: Sailors accused of spying for China set to appear in court
description: Two Navy sailors accused of spying for China, Jinchao "Patrick" Wei and Wenheng Zhao, will appear in federal court on Tuesday in California

title: US has 'direct contact' with Niger's coup leaders but conversations are 'difficult'
description: The U.S. Department of State acknowledged for the first time on Monday that American diplomats have been speaking with Nigerien military figures behind the takeover.

title: Man arrested in shooting death of 9-year-old in Chicago, police say
description: A man has been arrested for shooting and killing a 9-year-old in a Chicago's Portage Park on Saturday night, police said.

title: Mourners gather in Ireland to pay their respects to singer Sinead O'Connor
description: Fans are gathering in singer Sinead O’Connor’s former hometown in Ireland to say goodbye ahead of her funeral

title: Arrest warrants issued after boaters attack dock employee at Montgomery riverbank
description: Police in Montgomery issued four arrest warrants for individuals involved in a massive brawl between white boaters and a Black dock employee at Riverfront Park.

title: Daniel Penny defense fund raises millions -- and alarm bells for some
description: Daniel Penny has raised almost $3 million in a legal defense fund following charges in the killing of homeless man Jordan Neely.

title: Israel demolishes home of alleged Palestinian attacker, fueling West Bank tensions
description: Israeli security forces say they demolished the West Bank home of a Palestinian man accused of carrying out a deadly shooting attack earlier this year

title: Woman in critical condition after being bitten by shark at Rockaway Beach in NYC
description: A 50-year-old woman was rushed to the hospital in critical condition Monday after being bitten by a shark at Rockaway Beach in Queens, officials said.

title: WATCH:  Severe storms lash several states
description: Severe storms lashed several states in the South and along the East Coast, bringing torrential rain, golf ball-sized hail and tornado watches to some areas.

title: Tory Lanez's sentencing in Megan Thee Stallion shooting pushed to Tuesday
description: Rapper Tory Lanez appeared in court on Monday to be sentenced for shooting and injuring Megan Thee Stallion on July 12, 2020.

title: Carcinogens found at Montana nuclear missile sites as reports of hundreds of cancers surface
description: The Air Force has detected unsafe levels of a likely carcinogen in samples taken at a Montana missile base where a striking number of men and women have reported cancer diagnoses

title: Simon & Schuster purchased by private equity firm KKR for $1.62 billion
description: Simon & Schuster has been sold to the private equity firm KKR, months after a federal judge blocked its purchase by rival publisher Penguin Random House because of concerns that competition would shrink the book market

title: Judges halt a Biden rule offering student debt relief for those alleging colleges misled them
description: A federal appeals court has put on hold a rule from President Joe Biden’s administration that makes it easier to obtain student loan debt relief for some borrowers

title: Nearly all teens on Idaho YMCA camp bus that crashed have been released to their families
description: Idaho State Police say nearly all of the teenage campers involved in a YMCA camp bus crash on Friday have been released to their families

title: Firearm count added against Indiana man charged in block party shooting that killed 1, injured 17
description: A prosecutor has filed a felony firearm sentencing enhancement against a Muncie man charged with two counts of aggravated battery in connection with a shooting that left one person dead and 17 others wounded in the central Indiana city
